<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GOVERNMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/13/house-democrats-propose-29-trillion-tax-increases?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
With Tax Plan, Democrats Try to Unite Democrats
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/13/house-democrats-propose-29-trillion-tax-increases?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt='Old fire extinguisher box that says "In Case of Tax Hikes, Break Glass" with wad of cash inside' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83Mzk5L3RheF9oaWtlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">House Democrats are all of us before wedding season as they scramble to cover the bill for their pricey $3.5 trillion budget proposal. Yesterday, they <a href="https://www.axios.com/democrats-tax-increases-wealthy-5de1ce55-a92e-433a-8481-bfddcd23f1a8.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> a plan that included about $2.9 trillion in tax hikes. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Reality check: </strong>Unless you’re the CEO of Target or clutching your third boat, you won’t be targeted by the increases, which aim to raise money from corporations, wealthy Americans, and investors. Here are some of the deets:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For bigger, profitable companies, the corporate tax rate would jump to 26.5% from 21% currently.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Americans who earn more than $435,000 per year would see their top tax rate </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2021/09/12/manchin-sanders-reconciliation/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increase</a></span><span> from 37% to 39.6%.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Individuals earning over $5 million would get hit with a 3% surtax.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The top capital gains rate (taxes on the sale of stocks, real estate, NFTs of gorillas) would jump from 20% to 25%.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">On the spicy scale, this plan is mild</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While it reverses many of the Republican tax cuts for 2018, the plan <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/13/us/politics/tax-democrats-budget.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stops short</a> of the ambitious tax hikes President Biden first proposed. For instance, he initially wanted to bump the corporate rate up to 28% (26.5% in the new plan) and the top capital gains rate to 39.6% (25% in the plan). Plus the proposal doesn’t include the Senate Finance Committee’s taxes on billionaires’ investments, where most of their wealth is tied up.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This tax proposal is seen as an olive branch to moderate Democrats who don’t want to play the villain to business. However, it’s not nearly tame enough to gain support from Republicans.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>You’d think that a $2.9 trillion tax proposal to fund the biggest social spending plan since the ’60s would be the No. 1 priority on Capitol Hill, but it’s not. Lawmakers must pass a budget before Oct. 1 or else face a government shutdown, and time is also running out to <a href="https://thehill.com/policy/finance/571651-us-could-default-on-national-debt-as-soon-as-mid-october-analysis?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raise</a> the debt ceiling before the US defaults. <em>– MM</em></p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/13/walmarts-crypto-partnership-lite-truth?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Walmart's Crypto Deal Was too Weird to Be True
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/13/walmarts-crypto-partnership-lite-truth?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Meme for Walmart-Litecoin hoax" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83Mzk3L21lbWVfZm9yX3dhbG1hcnQtbGl0ZWNvaW5faG9heC5qcGVnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Someone just pulled off the biggest hoax since Bishop Sycamore weaseled its way onto ESPN.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A press release published yesterday morning by GlobeNewswire stated that Walmart would <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/13/walmart-to-accept-payments-with-cryptocurrencies-using-litecoin.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">accept litecoin</a>, a small cryptocurrency, as payment. While the partnership sounded odd, the release seemed pretty legit—litecoin’s official Twitter handle tweeted out a link to the announcement, and news outlets like Reuters posted stories.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After reporters did some digging, though, it became clear this was fake news. That caused litecoin prices, which had <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-13/cryptocurrencies-fall-after-walmart-says-no-pact-with-litecoin?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surged</a> up to 33% due to the “partnership,” to fall back down.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everyone went into clean-up mode: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Litecoin’s creator said its social media manager was “</span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/walmart-says-litecoin-partnership-news-release-is-fake-11631545453?mod=hp_lista_pos5" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrong to retweet</a></span><span>” the announcement.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Intrado, the company that operates GlobeNewswire, said it is looking into how the fake release, which even included a made-up quote from Walmart’s CEO, got through its filters.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Scammers have faked news announcements for “pump and dump” schemes before, but cryptocurrencies, which are less regulated and more volatile than public company stocks, are particularly fertile ground for hoaxes. <em>– NF</em></p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
POLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/13/know-californias-recall-election?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
California’s Recall Election: What You Need to Know
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="SAN LEANDRO, CALIFORNIA - SEPTEMBER 08:  California Gov. Gavin Newsom sp..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83Mzk4L3ZpY2VfcHJlc2lkZW50X2thbWFsYV9oYXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Justin Sullivan/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">California, the most populous state in the US and the fifth-largest economy in the world, will <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/08/california-recall-election-what-to-know.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decide</a> today whether Democratic Gov. Gavin Newsom should remain in office. If Newsom is recalled, his successor would serve the remainder of his term, which is set to end in January 2023.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> Many Californians have disapproved of the governor’s handling of homelessness, water policy, and undocumented immigrants. This recall effort, which started in February 2020, grew into a real threat throughout 2020 as the pandemic worsened in the state.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This election has consequences far beyond California. It will be the first test of Democrats’ strength ahead of next year’s midterm elections, and, if certain things shake out just right, it may even influence which party has control of the US Senate. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here's where things stand right now:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The latest polls compiled by FiveThirtyEight </span><span><a href="https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/california-recall-polls/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">show</a></span><span> Newsom with a sizeable lead.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Radio talk show host Larry Elder is the Republican frontrunner, leading 45 other candidates trying to take Newsom’s spot. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Recalls are as Californian as breakfast burritos for dinner; in fact, there have been 179 attempts since 1913. But few have prompted an election and only six officials have actually been recalled. <em>– SQ</em></p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Jason Sudeikis will make nearly <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/ted-lasso-pay-raises-season-three-1235011799/?utm_source=morning_brew#recipient_hashed=4099e28fd37d67ae86c8ecfc73a6b7b652abdcdb75a184f8cf1f8015afde10e9" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$1 million per episode</a> for season 3 of <em>Ted Lasso, </em>according to the Hollywood Reporter. That's a nearly 4x raise from seasons 1 and 2. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“New York will no longer be anti-business. This is going to be a place where we welcome business and not turn into the dysfunctional city that we have been for many years.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Eric Adams, the Democratic nominee for NYC mayor, wants to <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/13/nyregion/eric-adams-business-crime.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reset</a> the relationship between the leadership of the city and its business community. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read:</strong> Facebook says its rules apply to all, but company documents reveal a secret elite that’s exempt. (<a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-files-xcheck-zuckerberg-elite-rules-11631541353?mod=hp_lead_pos7" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ</a>)</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BIOTECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/13/colossal-raises-15-million-repopulate-siberia-woolly-mammoths?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The<em> </em>'Ice Age' Remake Is Very Realistic
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/13/colossal-raises-15-million-repopulate-siberia-woolly-mammoths?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="wooly mammoth biotech" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MzgwL2NvbG9zc2FsX2ZvdW5kZXJzX2NvbXByZXNzZWQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Colossal</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A new company called Colossal intends to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2021/09/12/biotech-startup-raised-millions-resurrect-wooly-mammoths?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">re-create and re-introduce</a> the extinct woolly mammoth to the Siberian tundra.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it (could) work: </strong>Entrepreneur Ben Lamm and Harvard genetics professor George Church, who have raised $15 million in funding from strategic investors including Sid the Sloth, plan to use CRISPR gene-editing technology to create a new species that’s close to, but not an exact replica of, the woolly mammoths that roamed the Arctic before disappearing roughly 10,000 years ago.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">OK, but why? </strong>A mammoth revival could <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/science/2021/sep/13/firm-bring-back-woolly-mammoth-from-extinction?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">contribute</a> to the fight against climate change—for example, through slowing permafrost thaw in the tundra by removing trees and trampling moss, Dr. Church has argued.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>if everything goes according to plan, the company could begin “rewilding” mammoths in 15 years, Lamm said. But it’ll have to navigate an <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/13/science/colossal-woolly-mammoth-DNA.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ethical minefield</a> to get there.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Emerging Tech Brew has a whole lot more about Colossal <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2021/09/12/biotech-startup-raised-millions-resurrect-wooly-mammoths?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>. <em>– NF</em></p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHouse Democrats are all of us before wedding season as they scramble to cover the bill for their pricey $3.5 trillion budget proposal. Yesterday, they \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/democrats-tax-increases-wealthy-5de1ce55-a92e-433a-8481-bfddcd23f1a8.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased\u003c/a\u003e a plan that included about $2.9 trillion in tax hikes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReality check: \u003c/strong\u003eUnless you’re the CEO of Target or clutching your third boat, you won’t be targeted by the increases, which aim to raise money from corporations, wealthy Americans, and investors. Here are some of the deets:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor bigger, profitable companies, the corporate tax rate would jump to 26.5% from 21% currently.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAmericans who earn more than $435,000 per year would see their top tax rate \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2021/09/12/manchin-sanders-reconciliation/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincrease\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from 37% to 39.6%.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIndividuals earning over $5 million would get hit with a 3% surtax.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe top capital gains rate (taxes on the sale of stocks, real estate, NFTs of gorillas) would jump from 20% to 25%.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOn the spicy scale, this plan is mild\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile it reverses many of the Republican tax cuts for 2018, the plan \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/13/us/politics/tax-democrats-budget.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estops short\u003c/a\u003e of the ambitious tax hikes President Biden first proposed. For instance, he initially wanted to bump the corporate rate up to 28% (26.5% in the new plan) and the top capital gains rate to 39.6% (25% in the plan). Plus the proposal doesn’t include the Senate Finance Committee’s taxes on billionaires’ investments, where most of their wealth is tied up.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis tax proposal is seen as an olive branch to moderate Democrats who don’t want to play the villain to business. However, it’s not nearly tame enough to gain support from Republicans.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eYou’d think that a $2.9 trillion tax proposal to fund the biggest social spending plan since the ’60s would be the No. 1 priority on Capitol Hill, but it’s not. Lawmakers must pass a budget before Oct. 1 or else face a government shutdown, and time is also running out to \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/policy/finance/571651-us-could-default-on-national-debt-as-soon-as-mid-october-analysis?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraise\u003c/a\u003e the debt ceiling before the US defaults. \u003cem\u003e– MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSomeone just pulled off the biggest hoax since Bishop Sycamore weaseled its way onto ESPN.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA press release published yesterday morning by GlobeNewswire stated that Walmart would \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/13/walmart-to-accept-payments-with-cryptocurrencies-using-litecoin.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccept litecoin\u003c/a\u003e, a small cryptocurrency, as payment. While the partnership sounded odd, the release seemed pretty legit—litecoin’s official Twitter handle tweeted out a link to the announcement, and news outlets like Reuters posted stories.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter reporters did some digging, though, it became clear this was fake news. That caused litecoin prices, which had \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-13/cryptocurrencies-fall-after-walmart-says-no-pact-with-litecoin?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurged\u003c/a\u003e up to 33% due to the “partnership,” to fall back down.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEveryone went into clean-up mode: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLitecoin’s creator said its social media manager was “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/walmart-says-litecoin-partnership-news-release-is-fake-11631545453?mod=hp_lista_pos5\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrong to retweet\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e” the announcement.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIntrado, the company that operates GlobeNewswire, said it is looking into how the fake release, which even included a made-up quote from Walmart’s CEO, got through its filters.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eScammers have faked news announcements for “pump and dump” schemes before, but cryptocurrencies, which are less regulated and more volatile than public company stocks, are particularly fertile ground for hoaxes. \u003cem\u003e– NF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nCalifornia’s Recall Election: What You Need to Know\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"SAN LEANDRO, CALIFORNIA - SEPTEMBER 08:  California Gov. Gavin Newsom sp...\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83Mzk4L3ZpY2VfcHJlc2lkZW50X2thbWFsYV9oYXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eJustin Sullivan/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCalifornia, the most populous state in the US and the fifth-largest economy in the world, will \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/08/california-recall-election-what-to-know.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edecide\u003c/a\u003e today whether Democratic Gov. Gavin Newsom should remain in office. If Newsom is recalled, his successor would serve the remainder of his term, which is set to end in January 2023.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e Many Californians have disapproved of the governor’s handling of homelessness, water policy, and undocumented immigrants. This recall effort, which started in February 2020, grew into a real threat throughout 2020 as the pandemic worsened in the state.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis election has consequences far beyond California. It will be the first test of Democrats’ strength ahead of next year’s midterm elections, and, if certain things shake out just right, it may even influence which party has control of the US Senate. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHere's where things stand right now:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe latest polls compiled by FiveThirtyEight \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/california-recall-polls/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshow\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Newsom with a sizeable lead.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRadio talk show host Larry Elder is the Republican frontrunner, leading 45 other candidates trying to take Newsom’s spot. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Recalls are as Californian as breakfast burritos for dinner; in fact, there have been 179 attempts since 1913. But few have prompted an election and only six officials have actually been recalled. \u003cem\u003e– SQ\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\"
